results.title: Emu Spew
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, SKA TV and Campbell Manderson
results.brief_description: Report on the efforts of the Adnyamathanha people, traditional landowners of the Northern Flinders Rangers to stop the Beverly Uranium Mining Project. The report also covers police action against the protestors and the unsafe method the mining company are using to extract the uranium. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Emu hunt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Alcheringa (A)”.
Hunting for the Australian Aborigine’s most prized form of food - the emu. Two men after finding eggs follow the spoor across the desert, with their spears held ready to catch their prey.

results.title: Emu
results.brief_description:
An intriguing and entertaining piece of work about an emu and her chick as they meander their way through urban streets in outback Broken Hill, NSW, confronting various challenges along the way. With no narration and using a music soundtrack this appealing doco captures the endearing qualities of these amazing Ozzie birds.
Camera, editing and music by Sean O’Keeffe.

results.title: Empty Quarter
results.brief_description:
Set in Djibouti, this story is filmed in subjective camera style. An introspective, slightly self-absorbed journalist asks a French woman to share a room with him. He is attracted to her but is not sure how to go about making that point clear. They spend their time in banal conversation. After seeing an Australian movie (‘The man from Snowy River’) they decide to make their way across the desert to Alexandria.

Credits: Producers, Pascale Dauman, Francois Margolin ; director, Raymond Depardon ; writer, Raymond Depardon ; photography, Raymond Depardon.
Cast: Francoise Prenant.

results.title: Empty Land-New Life
results.brief_description: In 1956 the Ministry for Housing implemented the “Elderly Persons Housing Project” in an attempt to meet the growing demands for public housing by senior citizens. Over the years building costs have increased rapidly and the Ministry feels that if the Community were to donate land for the project this will enable them to continue building suitable accommodation at affordable prices.

results.title: Empty harbours, empty dreams
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker, Barry Cowling and Kent Martin
results.brief_description: The film explores how the three British colonies of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island became provinces of Canada, and it charts the subsequent decline of their economies after Confederation. Photographs, archival drawings, cartoons, and interviews with Maritime historians are used to document the case. An important contribution to the continuing dialogue on the history and evolution of Canada’s federal system.

results.title: Empty arms, broken hearts
results.creator_credit: Iain E. Gillespie, Jacqueline Gillespie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and AFFC
results.brief_description: A film by publicised parents of kidnapped children, Jacqueline and Iain Gillespie, this documentary attempts to enlighten it’s viewer of the torment and distress involved in losing a child to kidnapping by a parent. It also raises the problems associated with bringing into place international treaties designed to allow a country authority to pursue the kidnapping parent and return the child to his/her other parent at home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Iain E. Gillespie, Jacqueline Gillespie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and AFFC

results.title: Empowering people (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video uncovers the secrets of how to get people motivated to take more initiative, be more responsible, and reach their potential. Four main steps are recommended. One: empower yourself. This step is directed as managers/supervisors/team leaders; if managers behave like victims, externalising all their problems (i.e. blaming everyone and everything else) then staff will follow suit. Two: Demonstrate empowerment. For managers this means to accept responsibility for problems and go about fixing them your self. Three: give management guarantees that you (i.e. the employee) will implement suggestions. Four: take risks; directed at managers, the recommendation is to listen to and pilot staff ideas, not trounce on them, otherwise managers will be stymieing employees’ creative thinking and potentially losing out on implementing new and successful ideas.

results.title: Employment interview
results.creator_credit: C Moray Foutz, Art Babbitt and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
The importance of the employment interview in getting the right person on the job. A brief review of poor hiring methods is given to illustrate how good workers can be overlooked in favour of less qualified, more aggressive, workers when those who do the hiring are untrained or indifferent. The film then illustrates a good interview, step by step; obtaining information through application forms and friendly discussion, testing, use of rating scale, etc. The function of foreman and supervisors in the interview is discussed, and pre-induction preparation of the applicant hired is shown.

results.title: Employing blind workers in industry
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Caravel Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
It is vitally necessary for the placement-specialist for blind workers to check up on the tyupes of jobs available, and the safety factors of each particular job. When a blind worker is placed in a job, the placement-specialist must see that the job foreman understands the important things to remember when supervising the work of a blind worker, or when explaining a process to them.
